cyclone.name: ISAIAS
cyclone.current_location: about 40 mi (70 km) ESE of West Palm Beach, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to move north-northwest along the Florida east coast today, then accelerate north-northeast Monday and Tuesday, tracking inland across the Carolinas and reaching the Mid-Atlantic states (including southeastern Pennsylvania/New Jersey) late Tuesday into early Wednesday before re-emerging offshore New England.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southern North Carolina coast near the Surf City/Wilmington area

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of South Santee River, SC to Surf City, NC (Tropical Storm Watch)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hallandale Beach, FL to South Santee River, SC (Tropical Storm Warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire U.S. east coast from Florida through the Mid-Atlantic and New England
weather_observation.wind: Tropical storm-force winds (35–45 mph with higher gusts) possible Tuesday night into Wednesday at the port.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Only minor surge (1–2 ft) possible on the Delaware Bay; limited effect upriver at the port.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rain of 2–5 inches with isolated 6–7 inches could cause flash and urban flooding in and around Philadelphia.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Increased river levels and hazardous marine/harbor conditions; embedded short-lived tornado threat cannot be ruled out.
